biome.definition: A natural region characterized by certain types of vegetation, climate, and animals living together. For example, a tropical rainforest or a desert.

ecosystem.definition: A place where living things interact with each other and their environment. It includes plants and animals as well as the soil, water, and climate of that place.

photosynthesis.definition: The process by which plants use sunlight to produce their own food and release oxygen into the air.

erosion.definition: The wearing away of soil caused by wind and rain. It can cause fertile soil to be lost.

habitat.definition: The natural place where an animal or plant lives and finds everything it needs to survive.

sustainable development.definition: A way of using natural resources that meets our current needs without endangering the resources that future generations will need.

deforestation.definition: The excessive cutting down of trees in a forest or jungle, which can cause serious damage to the environment.

biodiversity.definition: The variety of living things that exists in a particular place, including plants, animals, and other organisms.

precipitation.definition: Water that falls from clouds in the form of rain, snow, or hail.

foliage.definition: The collection of leaves on trees and plants.

deciduous.definition: Refers to trees that lose their leaves during certain times of the year.

evergreen.definition: Refers to plants that keep their leaves throughout the entire year.

xerophyte.definition: A plant adapted to living in places with very little water, like cacti in the desert.

pollution.definition: The presence of harmful substances in the air, water, or soil that can affect living things.

smog.definition: A mixture of smoke and fog that pollutes the air in cities, mainly caused by cars and factories.

microclimate.definition: The special climate conditions that occur in a small area, such as within a city.

urban forest.definition: The trees found in cities that help improve air quality and make city life more pleasant.

rainforest.definition: A type of forest with many trees, plants, and animals found in hot and rainy areas.

forest.definition: An area with many trees. It can be temperate (with seasons) or tropical (always hot).

prairie.definition: An area with lots of grass and herbs but few trees, ideal for farming and raising livestock.
